result.execSummary:
The defendant Saige Marcus Weiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:  
A.  I agree to pay restitution in the amount of $7250.60 joint & several with co-defendants.
B.  I will complete 160 hours of community service through the Buffalo-Pepin County CJCC.  Termination from this program will constitute a violation of this agreement.
C.  I will provide truthful testimony against any/all co-defendants at PH or trials.

Pay restitution as determined of $7250.60 joint & several with other co-defendants. Order as follows:  
JAIL:  The Defendant is committed to the Pepin County Jail for ten (10) days on August 1, 2017 at 6:00 pm and an additional ten(10) days at 6:00 pm on the 1st day of each month thereafter. Imposition of jail for a particular month is stayed and need not be served if the defendant does any of the following:  1) If by the 1st of such month the amount of $250.00 for restitution is received by your supervising probation agent, or; 2) Imposition of jail for a particular month may also be stayed by further order of this Court upon motion by any party and notice to all parties demonstrating that a change of financial circumstances making it financially impractical for him to make a full payment that month, or: 3) If the defendant obtains and maintains employment with a wage assignment in effect sufficient to pay his monthly restitution payment.  If the payment is not made as ordered by 1st of each month and the service of jail is not stayed as set forth above, a warrant may be issued for his arrest and the defendant may be taken into custody to be brought immediately before this Court for further proceedings.

Restitution concurrent with Pepin County Case No. 2015CM59.
AMENDED 12-04-2017:  Restitution payments each month amended to $150.00 per month.
Pay costs/surcharges according to a schedule as set forth by Probation & Parole and after Restitution is paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Ordered up to 25% of prison funds to be collected by the Department of Correction for restitution purposes.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. ADDRESS INFO for Saige Marcus Weiss
Current: 2415 Bostrom Court, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 09-29-2017)
Prior: 1515 Blue Stem Blvd Room 418, Altoona, WI 54720 United States
Letter in support of defendant by T.L.
Restitution Information

Defendant Saige Marcus Weiss in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Counsel confirms rec'd PSI and reviewed with client; no corrections.  State belives DOC recommendation appropriate, no addt'l cond. jail, restitution not paid anything.  Defendant apologizes to victim.  Defense counsel agrees with recommendation.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 5 yrs. probation; ordered pay restitution as determined of $7250.60 joint & several with other defendants; order defendant report to jail on 8/1 for 10 days unless by that date 1 of 3 things has happened.  1)Paid $250 to agent for restitituion.  2)Have a job with a wage assignment to pay the $250.  3)Write court to be relieved from jail for reasonable explanation on why not being able to pay.  10 days every month unless the $250 is paid; pay costs of case but restitution be paid first; pay costs of case; provide a DNA sample; comply with any assessment or counseling requested by P&P;  demonstrate responsibility by diligently seeking or maintaining full-time employment; same no contact provision as in other case.
Demonstrate responsibility by obtaining either your GED or HSED within the first 6 months of probation;
DOC sent through another PSI due to errors on the one filed previously.
Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Saige Marcus Weiss in court with attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation review hearing for being terminated from community service; motion to revoke on the felony for failure to complete C/S.  State also notes defendant has made no payments on the $7200 restitution owed.  DOC Agent C.R. by phone, informs they talked about setting up $50 monthly payments but unsure if payments set up with previous agent; confirms no payments made towards restitution; was on seek work from 11/10/16 from previous agent with 5 attempts per week; had ordinance violation 10/23/16 for urinating in public.  Court provides defendant with copy of the Community Service Agreement and Deferred Acceptance Agreement and refers to page 3 of the DPA, failure to complete C/S is a violation of the agreement.  Court revokes agreement and finds defendant guilty, inquires if State requests any Bond.  State notes defendant on probation, request $2500 Sign. Bond.  Court sets $2500 Sign. Bond.  On Probation case, modify probation and sentence to 30 days in the Pepin County Jail commencing immediately, order PSI.  Referred to JA to schedule sentencing hrg. @ 60 days out.  Defendant to update his address with Clerk.  1515 Blue Stem Blvd Room 418, Altoona, WI  54720.
Motion hearing on April 25, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Any conditions of bond cont'd.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Saige Marcus Weiss in court with attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State informs the court the parties have had discussions of potential resolution.  Atty Harrelson would like more time to review the restitution.  Atty Harrelson informs the court his client waives PH, files WOPH form with the court.  Court reviews WOPH with defendant and finds defendant knowingly & voluntarily WPH, bind over for trial; instructs the DA to file an Information within 30 days and see the scheduling clerk to schedule an Arraignment.  Any conditions of bond continued.
Cont'd.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Saige Marcus Weiss in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties, constitutional rights, felony conviction prohibitions and right to preliminary hearing.  State requests $5000 cash bond on all defendants with conditions:  no possession of firearm; no possession or consumption of alcohol or entry in bars or taverns.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash with conditions: no contact with co-defendants; no possession of firearms; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns; no other violations of law.  Defendant agrees to continue matter to contact an attorney.  Court notes waiver of time limits of P.H. which can be reasserted at any time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
